description: From Middle English constituten, from Latin cōnstitūtum, neuter of cōnstitūtus, past participle of Latin cōnstituō (“to put in place, set up, establish”).

verbs.description: constitute (third-person singular simple present constitutes, present participle constituting, simple past and past participle constituted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To set up; to establish; to enact.
(transitive) To make up; to compose; to form.
examples: Truth and reason constitute that intellectual gold that defies destruction.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To appoint, depute, or elect to an office; to make and empower.
examples: Me didst Thou constitute a priest of thine.
